summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on June 15, 2021, with a former correctional officer from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview recording, transcript, and related prison documents.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of the official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of Jeffrey Epstein.
A former correctional officer from MCC New York was interviewed on June 15, 2021, regarding events on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.
The memorandum lists several attachments, including daily assignment rosters and count documentation from MCC New York for August 9-10, 2019.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
